title: Great Falls Park: History & Culture
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture             History & Culture         Two women view the falls in the 1920s.   A trading place. A place to fish. A canal and town. An amusement park. A place to discover nature. During the past ten thousand years, the Great Falls of the Potomac has been the location of all of these, and more. From trading to recreation, people have been drawn here for thousands of years. The reasons why people come to Great Falls, both in the past and in the present, are as varied as the people themselves. On these pages, discover the history and the stories of this unique place.
